theory_metadata.source_work: An Economic Theory of Democracy (Downs); The Logic of Collective Action (Olson)
theory_metadata.theoretical_tradition: Political economy, public choice, microeconomic theory
theory_metadata.original_purpose: Explain political and social behavior through assumption of rational utility maximization by individual actors

telos.primary_purpose: Predict and explain political behavior by modeling actors as rational utility maximizers making optimal choices given constraints
secondary_purposes: Analyze collective action problems and their solutions
Predict voting behavior and political participation
Explain policy outcomes through rational actor interactions
Model strategic behavior in political and economic contexts
telos.theoretical_scope: Individual and collective decision-making in political and economic contexts
telos.domain_applicability: Policy statements, strategic decisions, cost-benefit analysis, resource allocation discussions, political choices

classification.tier_justification: Generates specific predictions about behavior based on utility calculations and strategic interactions

actors.definition: Decision-making entities assumed to be rational utility maximizers

choices.definition: Available options or strategies actors can select from

utilities.definition: Subjective values or benefits actors derive from different outcomes

constraints.definition: Limitations that restrict actor choices and strategy options

information.definition: Knowledge available to actors for decision-making

rational_choice_assumptions.utility_maximization: Actors choose options that maximize their expected utility
rational_choice_assumptions.stable_preferences: Actor preference orderings remain consistent across similar situations
rational_choice_assumptions.complete_ordering: Actors can rank all available options from most to least preferred
rational_choice_assumptions.transitivity: If A > B and B > C, then A > C in actor preference ordering
rational_choice_assumptions.strategic_behavior: Actors consider others' likely responses when making choices

choice_mechanisms.cost_benefit_analysis: Systematic comparison of expected costs and benefits for each option
choice_mechanisms.expected_utility_calculation: Probability-weighted assessment of outcomes across different scenarios
choice_mechanisms.strategic_interaction: Game-theoretic consideration of other actors' responses
choice_mechanisms.satisficing: Selection of first option meeting minimum acceptable criteria
choice_mechanisms.optimization: Selection of mathematically optimal choice given constraints

behavioral_predictions.free_rider_problem: Individuals will under-contribute to collective goods when benefits are non-excludable
behavioral_predictions.median_voter_theorem: Democratic outcomes will converge toward median voter preferences
behavioral_predictions.collective_action_paradox: Rational individuals may not participate in collective action even when all would benefit
behavioral_predictions.economic_voting: Voters will support incumbents when economic conditions are favorable

step_1_applicability_assessment.description: Evaluate text suitability for rational choice analysis

criteria.decision_making_context: Clear choices or strategic decisions being made
criteria.utility_considerations: Evidence of cost-benefit thinking or value maximization
criteria.strategic_interaction: Multiple actors with potentially conflicting interests
criteria.resource_constraints: Limitations affecting choice feasibility or outcomes

step_1_applicability_assessment.scoring: 0.0-1.0 scale based on presence of rational choice elements
step_1_applicability_assessment.threshold: 0.6 minimum for meaningful rational choice analysis

step_2_actor_identification.description: Identify all decision-making actors and their characteristics
actor_analysis: Assess information access and processing capacity

step_3_choice_extraction.description: Identify available options and decision alternatives
choice_analysis: Extract explicitly stated options and alternatives
Identify implicit choices and strategic alternatives
choice_categorization: Strategic choices (cooperation vs. competition, timing, positioning)

step_4_utility_assessment.description: Identify values, preferences, and utility functions of actors
utility_analysis: Extract expressed preferences and value statements
Identify utility sources (power, wealth, security, ideology)
Determine time preferences and discount rates
preference_ordering: Rank actor preferences from most to least valued

step_5_constraint_identification.description: Identify limitations and constraints affecting rational choices
constraint_analysis: Identify institutional constraints (rules, procedures, legal limits)
Determine strategic constraints (opponent responses, coordination problems)

step_1_rationality_assessment.description: Evaluate how well actor behavior fits rational choice assumptions
rationality_analysis: Identify deviations from rational choice predictions

step_2_strategic_interaction_analysis.description: Analyze multi-actor strategic dynamics and game-theoretic elements
strategic_analysis: Evaluate commitment problems and credibility issues

step_3_equilibrium_prediction.description: Predict likely outcomes based on rational choice interactions
equilibrium_analysis: Identify dominant strategies for each actor

step_4_policy_implications.description: Generate policy predictions and prescriptions based on rational choice logic
policy_analysis: Predict policy outcomes under different institutional arrangements
Identify potential for collective action problems
Assess incentive compatibility of proposed policies
Evaluate unintended consequences of rational responses

internal_consistency.preference_ordering_coherence: Actor preferences exhibit transitivity and completeness
internal_consistency.utility_maximization_logic: Choices consistent with stated preferences and constraints
internal_consistency.constraint_recognition: Analysis properly accounts for resource and institutional limitations

theoretical_fidelity.rational_actor_assumption: Analysis treats actors as utility-maximizing rational decision-makers
theoretical_fidelity.methodological_individualism: Collective outcomes explained through individual rational choices
theoretical_fidelity.equilibrium_focus: Analysis seeks stable outcomes where no actor has incentive to deviate
theoretical_fidelity.efficiency_considerations: Evaluation includes assessment of economic efficiency and Pareto optimality

empirical_validation.preference_identification_accuracy: Valid extraction of actor utilities and preference orderings
empirical_validation.choice_outcome_mapping: Accurate connection between decisions and consequences

predictive_validation.behavioral_prediction_accuracy: Accurate prediction of actor choices based on utility calculations
predictive_validation.equilibrium_prediction_validity: Valid prediction of stable outcome configurations
predictive_validation.policy_outcome_forecasting: Accurate prediction of policy implementation results
predictive_validation.unintended_consequence_identification: Valid prediction of rational response effects
